meanings.definition: Of or relating to an obelisk.
meanings.sent1: The obeliscal monument stood tall in the city square.
meanings.sent2: The ancient obeliscal structure was a symbol of power and strength.
meanings.sent3: The obeliscal design of the building made it a unique sight in the town.
meanings.sent4: Her obeliscal earrings added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent5: The obeliscal shadow cast by the sundial marked the passage of time.

meanings.definition: Resembling an obelisk in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The obeliscal tower loomed over the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The obeliscal rock formation jutted out of the ground like a giant spike.
meanings.sent3: The obeliscal tree in the park looked like a natural sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The obeliscal silhouette of the mountain against the sunset was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The obeliscal outline of the building against the sky was striking.
